review.reviewBody: I used this for a three day car camping trip. I loved being able to sort through my things easily without making a mess of them due to the U shaped zipper to open the top. Love the shoe and side pockets. The backpack straps  are a little odd but I removed them for this use
review.name: Great camping bag

review.reviewBody: It’s was a little big to use as a gym bag for what I take to the gym which is why I bought it. BUT, I went on a 4 day trip and this dang bag is killer!!!!! I took everything I needed in this 40 duffel bad and it look great.
review.name: Plenty of space

review.reviewBody: I love this bag, I got two, this one and the bigger one. We are using it as our gear bags for mountain biking and we love all the compartments to organize everything for easy access. GET ONE!
review.name: LOVE IT

review.reviewBody: This is our second bag. The first has been our go to bag for a couple years and I finally bought my wife one so she would stop stealing mine. It is perfect as a carryon or weekend bag. Love it.
review.name: Best Bag

review.reviewBody: EXCELLENT. I BOUGHT THE 40L AND 60L. WATERPROOF,, HEAVY DUTY, STRONG ZIPPERS, HANDELS ON ALL SIDES, STURDY, HEAVY DUTY HANDLES, LOOPS ON THE OUTSIDE TO HAND STUFF ON.  40 L IS A GREAT GYM BAG, THE 60L ALLOWS FOR MORE GEAR, BOTH BAGS ARE WELL BALANCED.
review.name: ALL AROUND DUFFLE

review.reviewBody: I got this bag as a present and it has been a great gym bag. It fits everything I need and on top of that it, it looks great.
review.name: Great Size for Gym

review.reviewBody:
Love it - originally had ordered the 60L but swapped for a 40L. Sturdy construction and material. Can't tell the difference b/t this and the NF base camp duffels that cost twice as much. 

Just received it so this is an initial review - but super impressed.
review.name: Love it - excellent construction .

review.reviewBody:
Loved the bag so much I bought one for my mother and then bought two more a while later.

The 40L is a great gym bag. The waterproof side is perfect for dirty laundry. Zippers are hefty and the material is thick and durable.
review.name: Great bag, bought 4 so far.

review.reviewBody: I use this bag to keep all of my mountain bike gear ready to go at all times. I usually just leave it in my car. Fits my riding shoes, half-shell helmet, 2 pairs of knee pads, sunglasses case, and frame bag with extra room for spare parts, tools, snacks, and batteries. I really like the see-through mesh pockets on the inside flap for quickly locating my tire pressure gauge or hex keys.
review.name: Daily Duffel

review.reviewBody:
Purchased the Backcountry All Around 40L Duffel (Neutral Gray) based upon a recommendation from my gearhead.  The recommendation was an EXCELLENT choice, as this duffel is constructed very well, it is very robust and certainly several steps higher in quality, compared to other competitors of the same style of duffel.  The dry bag area is a nice feature.  I would rate this as a 5 star.
~Mike
review.name: EXCELLENT duffel

name: All Around 40L Duffel
Adventure-Ready Duffels & Backpacks For Travel | Behind The Design

hasVariant.name: Cheat Sheets
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Cheat Sheets online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are THE sheets you need for both short and long term storage of your skins to prolong the life of the glue. I don’t tour with them but as soon as I get back to the truck or cabin for the evening, I’m putting them on. No other brands skin sheets work as well.
review.name: The best skin sheets on the market

review.reviewBody: helpful for storing your skins and preserving the glue
review.name: work nicely

review.reviewBody: Super convenient and functional. Makes long term storage and protection of your Black Diamond Skins a breeze.
review.name: Quick and Easy

review.reviewBody: Different brands of touring skins may come with their own skin saver product, but the BD Cheat Sheets are the best. Flexible for easy folding/rolling or storage. Wide enough for even my most powdery powder ski skins.... these are my faves.
review.name: Best skin saver product

review.reviewBody: Being on the wide side, these are great for splitboard skins, which tend to be wider than ski skins, especially on volume-shifted boards like the Storm Chaser. The material seems durable and the surface texture is appropriately slick to better preserve the skin glue. A+
review.name: Excellent for splitboard skins

review.reviewBody: These are keeping my skins alive for much longer than before. Easy to use. I throw them on after touring and get the max life out of my gear
review.name: Keeps my skins sticky

review.reviewBody: The sheets work great in keeping your skin glue folded on itself but easier to peel apart when it's time to skin up. This is especially appreciated on the wide skins of my split snowboard.
review.name: Do what they are designed to do

review.reviewBody: These make life a lot easier when storing and applying skins. No more fighting with strong skin glue. So happy these are in my pack.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: After the last cheat sheet removal from my skins I now got a black raster stuck on my BD skins. The cheat skin was stuck so hard to the skins and hence separated. I figure that the minus 20 degrees Celsius in Norway didn’t help. Have never had this problem before, but considering how strong the skin glue is I am not surprised.
review.name: Great concept, but

review.reviewBody: They're easy to cut and light weight. Not helpful for mid terms.
review.name: Do the job

name: Cheat Sheets

review.itemreviewed: Perfetto RoS 2 Wind Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Road riding can be hard to stay warm. On the one hand, you are working, which heats you up. On the other hand,the harder you work, the more cold wind you generate. It is also often done in the open, so the weather often creates wind too, more so than mtb or such.
Then there are rain showers or fog. 
The Perfetto is a super useful and versatile layer for all this:
Completely windproof in the front and sleeves (which are long enough to mate well with arm warmers), but thin and breathable, so it doesn’t add insulation. This allows you to layer underneath for a wide range of conditions, or even take it off and pack it on the bike if it really heats up.
The Windstopper fabric on the front is waterproof (if clean), so it will protect you from wetness chilling you if it’s warm, or keep you dry for a short, gentle shower. 
Race fit, so size up if you don’t want that.
Also, it’s shaped for riding, so don’t try it on standing straight up right. 
This new version doesn’t have as long a drop tail anymore, unfortunately.
review.name: Perfect for road riding

name: Perfetto RoS 2 Wind Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: overall very solid except for the limited pockets. works as an outer layer for skiing, and the waterproofing it's great.
Great light weight jacket that protects you from rain.
review.name: Good staple piece

review.reviewBody: This jacket is as functional as it fashionable.  My go to jacket any time there is inclement weather. Very comfortable and size is perfect. No complaints with this jacket.  Thanks for a zipper that seems like it will hold up as long as the jacket.
review.name: Perfect Fit & Fashion

review.reviewBody: I live in New England, and I'm traveling to "old" England later this year. Between our record rainfall back home and variable conditions across the pond, I needed a good raincoat. Cue *hours* of research, which landed me here. So far I've worn this coat out in several storms for 10-20min at a time (walking the dog) and after a quick shake off in the mudroom, it's completely dry. And so am I! Plus it's quiet, blocks wind, and the material has a nice matte finish. The colors are lovely, classy green shades that go with everything. Got a medium and there's room to layer a fairly bulky coat or sweatshirt underneath but it's not huge if I'm just in a t-shirt. I'm 5'6", athletic 150lbs, 37-27-38. I'm literally excited to camp and hike in the rain this summer now that I'll have this coat to protect me. Now I just want OR to make a matching one for the dog.
review.name: A Worthy Investment

name: Stratoburst Stretch Rain Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Glove liners fit ok, the seams are a bit bulky. The material is comfortable and kept my hands try while buckling my skiboots etc.
The reason I bought these gloves was for the added touch screen compatibility, which only worked on the very first day of use. Second day it worked sporadically, third day it was done.

review.reviewBody: I bought these to pull double duty for cold weather runs and as a glove liner. I've only used them for running lately, but they've worked really well so far this season. review.name: great liners!

Buy the Old Town Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: We bought two Sportsman BigWater ePDL + 132 Kayaks and could not be more pleased with them. There is enough room for my 80 lb bouvier dog to join us and she loves it. The kayak is very stable for rough water, boat wakes and windy conditions. The battery life is exceptional, lasting several hours even if you are trolling and not pedaling at all.  We did buy a trailer to haul our two kayaks and that works very well!  Would highly recommend these kayaks for fishing, cruising lakes and rivers!
review.name: Highly, Highly Recommend the Sportsman ePDL + 132

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody:
I have 2 negatives about this kayak. 1. The Electronic Pedal Assist on levels 1-4 does not work unless conditions are perfect. When I have tried to use these levels I noticed zero difference in pedal resistance between Level 0 - manual and Levels 1-4 pedal assist modes. When I spoke to Old Town they blamed it on the weather conditions, here is what they said:
These levels are not meant to have a huge difference, like you feel with level 5.  They are meant to be minimal. Variables such as water conditions, wind, water current, battery voltage, gear weight, etc can all affect how much you feel the assist modes in each level.
Unless you intend to use the kayak only on very flat calm waters do not expect to notice any difference between Level 0 and levels 1-4. As I have not yet been able to kayak in totally calm conditions I cannot fully verify if there is any noticeable difference from Level 0 and electronic pedal assist Levels 1-4.
2. The kayak is not that stable, I almost capsized in it, on a day which was not particularly rough. This is due to the seat sitting high, leading to a higher center of gravity. I don't think this kayak would be safe if you were out and weather conditions deteriorated with large swells.
review.name: Unstable and ePDL Levels 1-4 are useless

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: I bought my Old Town BigWater ePDL+ 132 in February and thanks to warm weather, I've been out with it about 7 times. First, using the ePDL in all 3 modes, the battery will outlast your day of fishing. I use the cruise control and the assist mode when moving from spot to spot. While fishing, I use the drive manually. Transitioning from a Sportsman 120 PDL was simple. I have bad knees, so the BigWater ePDL+ 132 allows me to fully enjoy my day fishing on larger lakes. Although it may seem a bit pricey, the fact that you don't buy any additional items like batteries even out the cost.
review.name: Money well spent

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: This is the fastest electric powered kayak that I have ever been on. It may not have spot lock but I will get to the fishing spots before my buddies.
review.name: This is the fastest electric kayak!

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: Be on the water with limited setup and no need to lug heavyweight batteries.  This allows more time to catch fish!  Assisted pedal assist is amazing and if you need to get somewhere in a dash put it in cruise control mode and fly!!
review.name: A Hardcore Fishing Kayaker’s Dream

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple weeks ago had it out one  loved it  even pulled my buddy off the lake great time.
review.name: Love the way it moves

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody:
I have both the salty PDL and the autopilot. I don’t own this kayak but I have used it many times and it’s a great blend between the two. 

The ePDL+ is much easier to learn/more intuitive than the autopilot. Pedal forward to go forward, pedal backward to go backward. Hook into a fish while trolling, simply pedal backwards to turn off cruise control, your hands remain on the rod. Unlike the autopilot where when you hook into a fish while trolling, you now you need to fiddle with a remote to stop the motor. The only thing I prefer the autopilot for is that it has spot lock. 

I like being an active participant on the water, so I like having the option to pedal entirely manually, some assist, or not pedal at all. It has five different speeds, which is great for keeping a consistent speed while trolling, or when I’m fighting current or wind. The highest speed is FAST- great for getting to my destination quickly.  The battery life is excellent, especially if you do some pedaling.
review.name: Mostly better than the Autopilot

review.itemreviewed: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger
review.reviewBody: The Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ is a very easy to use kayak! Simple as charge plug and go! Love being able to use the electronic assist to save energy to stay on the water all day! The BigWater hull design it’s a very stable platform and does extremely well in choppy water!
review.name: One of a kind fishing platform

name: Sportsman BigWater ePDL+ 132 & Lithium Ion Battery/Charger

review.reviewBody: I'm a pretty average U.S. male medium: 32" waist, 40" chest, 6'. I wear a medium in Outdoor Research, Patagonia, etc. I first bought these bibs in a medium and the chest was super tight--very Euro fit up top. I returned them for a large and they fit ok up top but the legs were comically large to the point where they'd be a safety issue for ski touring. Not sure who the fit of these was designed for: super svelte upper body with some lumberjack thighs and coffee cans for calves? Bummer, because the materials and design are otherwise high quality.
review.name: Fit on these is bizarre

review.reviewBody: Great material and features. Immediately returning. The legs are freaking massive and super baggy. I ordered a large and am 165lbs and 6’2”. Great fit other than how baggy the pant legs are which is a bummer. No wonder they are 60% off. No one is using these is serious backcountry situations unless they have legs like tree trunks. I’m sorry for the negativity, just bummed.
review.name: Baggier than my 2001 Pants

review.reviewBody:
So to be clear the fit observations below aren't exactly true for everyone. Also the sizing chart posted here is way off and is responsible for probably not capturing the number of sales they should have on these supple but bomber britches.
I am 5'11" and 175 lbs. this morning in my skivvies with a 34–35-inch waist. My Levi 505 pant size is 33 waist 34 length. My Kuhl Renegade Rock Pants are 34/34 for reference.
I purchase both Large and XL. The XL I slid on and immediately too much room everywhere with the front of the bib coming up very high. Large is pretty much my normal size in ski pants and sometimes a medium tall in a bib will also work for me like from Stio but brands very for sure. The size large slipped on perfectly. enough room left over if I wanted to wear an insulator on the inside but I am old school and wear my insulation on the outside of the bib. 
 Initial impression: when  I pulled the waist tabs in about an inch on each side and these give me the fit I am looking for. Length is perfect for me in the Large. Got the Pine Green ones. I went with the Ortovox Sedrun Jacket also in Large Black and its perfect. This stuff is a rippin buy right now pretty sure you'll be happy. If you are on the fence pretty sure if you roll the dice you'll roll 7's.
review.name: Great fit Great look Great buy

review.reviewBody: I just received this and it looks like it will be a great bib for all around use.  The fit is definitely snug.  I am 5"11 155lbs with a 31 inch waist and 39 inch chest and the medium just fits me.   Another inch on my waist or chest and I would need a large.  Looking forward to using this up in Canada in a few weeks!
review.name: Snug Fit

review.reviewBody: I?m a 33 inch waist, 33 inch inseam, and 6?5?. I bought the large first - too small. Extra large fits ok. Not sure how people with much bigger waist or stomach/gut would be able to fit in even an extra large - Would be tight across chest. Very good wind and water protection. Packs down small. ?Back door? zippers very helpful for pit stops. Pockets are well positioned and roomy (though I wish the chest pocket faced inward versus outward). I got the green color.
review.name: Expensive but good

name: Deep Shell 3L Bib Pant - Men's

review.name: I love this top. It

As a lover of crop tops, sports bras, and interesting designs- this one will be one I want to show off as a designer top.

Can’t wait to have some more sun and water time to really wear it!

review.reviewBody: I have several of this top. I keep getting more. Comfortable for swimming, paddling and rafting.

review.reviewBody: I wasn't sure how I felt about these bibs at first, but after putting them through a bunch of rides, they've become my favorite bibs! The fit is absolutely on point. The leg openings fit my muscular quads without making them look like overstuffed sausages, and the grippers ensure they don't ride up ever. The longer inseam is really nice for the scorching Utah sun too. Endless pockets for plenty of snacks and tools so I don't have to wear a road jersey all the time, and although I haven't tested it, the drop seat seems like it would work great.
review.name: LOVE these Bibs

name: Cinder Cargo Bib Short - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Muc-Off Luxury Chamois Cream online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used several different brands of chamois cream over the years. I founds one that I really liked some years ago then the company went out of business. Moved over to ASSOS and that became my go-to until I discovered the Muc-off/Athlete Performance chamois cream. As everyone else says in their reviews, it smells great, the consistency is really nice, it gets the job done, and most of all? the much larger tub at only $2 more the value is amazing. Just like Casey K said in their review, I had to go back to ASSOS when this was out of stock and before I even finished that tub I bought more of this to get back to my favorite.
review.name: Long Live the King

name: Luxury Chamois Cream

review.reviewBody: The set works perfectly.  Love that the material is breathable.  The newer material completely eliminated the wet sock feeling you get with most rain gear on the market.  It allows easy movement, no restrictions and folds up easily , takes up as much room as a sweatshirt.  Feels good, works great.  So glad you invented gear that works, especially for us bigger anglers.
review.name: Excellent rain gear!  Breathable, moveable, and fit perfectly.

review.reviewBody: Great product! Fished all day in the rain and it kept me dry!

They are nice, I only wish they had not been designed so tight fitting, I would go with a different brand or pair if you are looking for something you could layer under to extend the temper ranges you could use them in

being a new paraplegic i am having to re think how i do anything. Having fished all my life i did not want to stop now and i had to figure out how i could keep fishing and stay dry. The Simms Challenger Fishing Bib has really worked out great for me doing a great job of keeping me dry and warm while i sit in my wheelchair and helps me fish all day, thank you
review.name: Simms Challenger Fishing Bib

review.reviewBody: Used them for the first time this week while fly fishing. No rain, but temperature dropped to about 40 degrees. Even though they are not insulated they were perfect for warmth. Along with my Simms deck boats I was comfortable all day.
review.name: Charger Bibbs and Deck Boots

review.reviewBody: Fit well, haven’t had a chance to use them yet. Heading to Canada, musky fishing in June, which is when I plan to break them in.
review.name: Challenger Bibs

review.reviewBody: Perfection achieved! I love everything about these… comfort, waterproof and nearly bullet proof.
review.name: Perfection achieved!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a Halloween costume for my black lab. Some modifications were necessary, he’s going as a salmon tosser at Seattle’s Pine Street Fish Market.
review.name: Dog’s love them

review.reviewBody: The bids I have worn for wind/cold protection, not for rain protection, they were very good.
review.name: Simms bibs

review.reviewBody: Very well done. Couldn't be happier with these bibs.
review.name: Excellent bibs

description: Buy the Blue Ice Moonlight 55L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moonlight 55L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blue Ice Moonlight 55L Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was so happy to see that they finally offered this pack in 2 torso lengths. Got the S/M but unfortunately it didn't quite fit me (I'm female, 5'5", about 135#). Specifically the shoulder straps were too widely spaced and they actually pushed against my arms. I have broad shoulders, but I'm finding that woman-specific packs fit me better. Tried the Mammut Neon 55 Women's and the shoulder straps fit better. 

Otherwise the pack has great features. It's one of the few crag packs with external pockets (and they are plenty big enough to fit a guide book or liter Nalgene bottle). I packed up my entire to kit and it seems to easily fit a 60m rope, double rack, alpine draws, shoes, helmet, layers, etc. Note that there is no lid--it's definitely more like an ergonomic haul bag. There also aren't any side compression straps, which would be nice to have if you carry a rope on top.
review.name: Great pack, didn't quite fit me

name: Moonlight 55L Pack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've recently received an order of roll-top waterproof bags from Sea to Summit. These bags are, as usual, of great quality and value. My other Sea to Summit bags have lasted for years without failure or problems of any kind. If your in the market for any kind of backpacking or bikepacking bags and need them to be a reliable part of your kit, Sea to Summit is the way to go.
review.name: Rolltop Waterproof Bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After extensive research, I ordered 2 bags. Have been impressed. Initially bought for use as fork bags for Bikepacking trips, but now see many other uses - rear bag for overnights, handlebar bag, or on kayaking adventures. Will likely get some other sizes too. Highly recommend for keeping your stuff dry in tough environments.
review.name: Best for Bikepacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] super tough and easy to secure to things! Amazing Product.
review.name: Awesome!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I see the new design is better and the attach points are stronger. 
Good Job on the redesign
review.name: Dry bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The dry bag was really good, I ended up needing to buy another one but had little time to get one shipped that I picked up another sea to summit one from REI. I needed them both for a river trip and they held up really well, only got a little water in it once and it did end up getting really dirty on the outside. But they worked really well, looked super cool, and weren’t too bulky. Loved them! I’d maybe consider getting the strap for my smaller one next time.
review.name: Pretty Great Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this for a Colorado River trip, and it worked perfectly. Easy to pack and load, and no moisture got in at all.
review.name: Great size/price/quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great outdooor/summer bag for water sports. Very well made and the materials are top notch. I will buy another for my son to use this summer.
review.name: Big river dry bag review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this dry bag for my kayaking excursions and I was not disappointed. They are perfect for quick and easy access. They are very durable and do exactly what they claim. Highly recommend these for any rugged water adventure.
review.name: Quality waterproofness

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use these little weight high quality products to separate item's. Then load them all into a 35L heavy weight dry sack. Perfect for my bike adventures.
review.name: Dry sacks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use this for bikepacking. My sleeping pad, bag liner, pillow, Tyvek sheet and quilt fit into it just right. I attach it to my rear rack with straps that hook to the rails. The daisy chain loops prevent slippage.
review.name: 13 Liter Drybag

name: Big River Dry Bag

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: I have been very pleased with the the Element Bolt.  It is easy to set up and use.  I have enjoyed using it.  I like the small profile.  The battery lasts me for about 8-10 hours of riding.
review.name: Great features, easy to use

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: I have only had the Element Bolt for one year and it no longer connects to GPS.  The unit is nice from a user perspective except that the most important feature no longer works after one year.  I had a Garmin unit for 9 years and it worked great the entire time.  I would not recommend this product.
review.name: Fails to connect to GPS

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: My other bikes have SRM's and I use the SRM Power Control for those but I bought a Stages for my bad weather bike and thought I'd try something new for a computer. Afterall, I'd rather expose this $300 unit to rain than my $750 Power Control, all things being equal.  So far it's is very reliable (have already ridden in two heavy downpours) and the screen is crisp and almost HD compared to my PC.  The map feature is great.  Really happy with this purchase and the Bolt may find it's way onto my A bike for a few rides this summer when I need a lot of map directions.
review.name: Really accurate

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody:
First time using any kind of bike computer for me, had very basic needs and the Bolt met all of them.  Setup was a breeze, took maybe 10min tops.  Take it out of the box, download the app, follow directions on there, so simple.  Included 31.8mm bar clamp out front mount fit great no issues there.  

Only used it for road rides so far, but seems like it does everything you'd need it to.  I went out for a couple rides just taking random turns and following the map.  Map seems to show roads that are good to ride a bike on in yellow, and others in white.  Not sure if this was just a coincidence?  Or if there is some kind of coding for roads with a bike lane/ shoulder.  But following the yellow line kept me comfortable.  Maps were very detailed and accurate for my area.

Flipping between the different pages was fun, I kept it on the map mostly so I was at least a little surprised on stats when my ride ended.  But a more data oriented person would really benefit from all the constant tracking.  That being said I did not connect it to any heart rate monitors or power meters, but poking around the app it seems like that would also be super easy to set up and view data.

Strava uploading was super easy and quick.  No complaints there. 

Screen seems kind of small?  Not necessarily a bad thing you could see everything just fine but on the main data page you could probably see a bit better on a larger screen (Elemnt Roam)  Also took ~30 seconds to boot up when you turn it on not instant.  Not really a big deal just turn it on before you put your shoes on and you'll be ready to go.

Overall, works great if you want to constantly be seeing your data while riding.  Being able to keep the phone at home and still map/ track Strava is convenient too!
review.name: Elemnt Bolt for dummies

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: So insanely happy with this purchase. Loading routes is a synch, syncing all the sensors was painless. Has great turn by turn notifications. I feel more confident checking out new routes in my area and exploring other areas as well. So happy with this purchase!
review.name: SO INSANELY HAPPY WITH THIS

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: I had heard that Wahoo was one of the most user-friendly brands out there and I have found that to be true with the Element Bolt. This seems to be a good fit whether you are a beginner, just getting into cycling or if you’re a triathlete. Easy and fast set up, battery life is great, lasting about 15 hours, and charging time is fast, but my favorite feature has to be the pre-loaded maps that show your current elevation, incline and they have turn by turn direction. It’s compatible with all Ant+ sensors, which means if you plan on using it inside you don’t have to own a Wahoo trainer. It worked well with my Tacx Neo 2T, although, it didn’t quite match up with the mileage shown on my Tacx app. One more thing that I really enjoyed was the LED lights at the top of the computer, which show you if you are on pace, behind, or ahead of your previous PR, it definitely inspires you to push a little harder to do better than your past self!
review.name: Wahoo Element Bolt GPS BC

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody:
Had the chance to test this, but don't own one.  It was really easy to set up.  I don't usually record my rides, or use a computer, but now I'm tempted to buy a Wahoo computer.  It was really accurate on the auto pause feature, but occasionally when I got really slow on a steep climb it did think I stopped.  This is probably more me than the computer though.
The LED lights are really cool.  They made me want to push myself into the red zone, work a little harder than normal.
Cool product would recommend.
review.name: Easy to use

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody:
The Bolt was really easy to set up initially, and get riding.  I do a lot of riding without tracking, or navigating, even though I have a wearable from another manufacturer.

The display screen is surprisingly motivating.  This computer encourages me to push the pace based on my heart rate, or prior efforts.  I'm not using a power, or cadence sensor right now, but I imagine the display for those would be even more motivating.  The LED lights add an awesome readable metric.

I have used this to navigate as well.  Zoomed in, it is very easy to maintain the correct navigation.  It's also really easy to zoom out in real time, on the bike.  Navigating between pages while on the bike is really easy in general.

Battery life has been really good.

Ease of use, and pleasant interface with the app are the biggest takeaways for me with this product.  It was an enjoyable experience right out of the box.  I didn't think I needed this computer, but now I love having it.  This would make an excellent gift if you don't know what to buy for a cyclist.
review.name: Exceeds Expectations

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody:
I have had this computer for a good while now, and after trying Garmin, Bryton, and other computers, I’ve decided that Wahoo has the best cycling computers to offer! It has a very user-friendly interface, making it easy to connect to your phone to upload rides to mobile apps, and it gives several stats as you are riding such as riding time, speed, distance, elevation, and more.
	This bike computer can also connect to a heart rate monitor, cadence sensor, power meter, and even your AXS drivetrain to give you even deeper feedback of your riding. Not only that, you can upload workout plans from apps such as TrainerRoad, so that you can follow your workout right from your bike computer!
	Another cool feature that I love about this computer is the LED bar at the top of the computer. This can be used to tell you what HR zone, power zone, or speed range you are in, so you can get an idea of your riding with just a quick glance! The LED’s will light up in different quantities and colors depending on what zone you are in, so that you don’t have to look down and try to read your data while you’re pedaling hard!
	This computer holds up against the most brutal riding weather, and I’ve been able to use this computer in all sorts of ride conditions. Everything from a recovery cruise around the neighborhood, to a 12+ hour day in the saddle! This computer’s been able to handle it all, continuing to give me accurate live analyses and helpful feedback. This computer has been perfect for my needs, and I would recommend it to anyone looking to get a deeper understanding of their riding ability!
review.name: It's got everything I need!

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer
review.reviewBody: Without a doubt the best device on the market! All the data you will ever need, simple to use and easy to figure out.
review.name: Best Device

name: ELEMNT BOLT V2 GPS Bike Computer

review.reviewBody:
Sizing chart says M is a 9.5; I'd say its closer to a 9 so if you're on the edge and unsure go up a size.

I have always owned Large and didn't realize it.. ordered the medium and they are slightly too small.

Beyond the size issue though; these things will last you a LONG time.  They do a good job of wicking, they are comfortable and thin but still provide decent cushion.  I pretty much only wear these socks given the opportunity.

They are meant to be tight so if your feet are damp at all they can be hard to put on.
review.name: Run a little small - but a great sock

review.reviewBody: These socks breathe super well, and actually wick moisture away from the foot at a noticeable rate.  These put 30$ a pair socks to shame at half the price.  The one drawback is the ankle of the socks are a little tight for me and I dont have large ankles.
review.name: Some of the best socks I've worn.

review.reviewBody: Used as workout/cycling socks and fit well.
review.name: Great socks

name: Performance Quarter Crew High Sock

review.reviewBody: Got these for my boyfriend who rides. They’re the newer, and apparently improved version of the same shorts he’s loved for a few years. He said they feel great, better the “favorite” pair so 5 stars! He’s getting another pair in a 2nd color!
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: Fit and material is good. Pockets are good size and zippers 9including at zipper) are quality/work well. But as with almost all shorts that have the Velcro adjust waist, these creep down. The “Skyline” logo inside the waistband is the grippy rubbery material, and I thought this would prevent them falling down (I have a pair of Pearl Izumi shorts that successfully pull this off), but it’s not enough. The waistband adjustment is just not heavy enough duty - the elastic is too elastic, and the Velcro contact patch isn’t large enough. Also, the button closure is vague feeling - it doesn’t “snap” together audibly. It presses together in a mushy sort of way that always makes me wonder how long it will last. EXTREMELY glad that I got these on sale and didn’t pay full price. Not worth it if not discounted.
review.name: OK Shorts, but some issues.

review.reviewBody: The short material feels light and durable.  The zipper fly and pockets appear sturdy.  Unfortunately the shorts are too short.  The inseam is only around 12" compared to the inseam of 14" on my other shorts.  This leads to a gap between my shorts and pads.  They would be great for people with short legs or someone riding without pads.  Also the blue color is not as bright as shown in the picture.
review.name: Too short for riding with pads

review.reviewBody: For some reason TLD puts out the same Skyline short every year with the same flaw: a velcro fly.  The velcro wears out quickly, say, after one season, then the fly constantly pops open.  I have other mtb shorts with zippers for the fly, and they work perfectly, season after season.  Should we support stupid people who work at companies like TLD?
review.name: Velcro wears out quickly

review.reviewBody: Sizing is weird, their 34 is really a 36.5in waist, 32 is 34.5in waist, etc
review.name: check the size chart

name: Skyline Short Shell - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Aenergy TR HS Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is an excellent jacket to keep you warm and protected from the elements during winter and shoulder season runs. I took it out during an ice storm a few weeks ago and with my micro spikes and this, I was warm and protected. Love the way that the hood stays secure.
review.name: Perfect Bad Weather Running Companion

review.itemreviewed: Aenergy TR HS Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I've run in this jacket 5-6 times now- including twice in the rain and can attest to its waterproof claims. The fit is nice and athletic - can wear a layer or two if needed, but not too baggy over a tee. The sleeves hit right at the end of my wrists- over my watch no problem, but also have elastic if you want them to sit higher. I am 5'8", a typical size 4 and the Small is perfect. 

It is a no frills jacket- just one simple chest pocket that is large enough for a cell phone but I don't find the placement comfortable for heavier items. It's perfect for your dog bags, key fob, very small pair of gloves. The elastic for the hood is VERY snug- I wore the hood up over a brimmed hat in the rain and found the collar rubbing up under my nose. When I unzipped it slightly the elastic is still strong enough to pull the collar up even with my mouth- I know the design is to be lightweight but an option to adjust tension would be great. 

If I were to make this jacket perfect, I would add a vent and maybe built in hand covers- because the pocket is small there isn't a place to put any mitts or gloves. I also find it runs warm- wearing it low 30s to mid-40s I only need a T-shirt underneath it and have had to unzip to dump heat.
review.name: Light, waterproof and athletic fit

name: Aenergy TR HS Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing these boots for about a month now and love them. I searched in local stores and on-line for a slip-on short boot because I’m having shoulder surgery soon and won’t be able to tie laces. Being that I live in NW Colorado, two important features are: good tread (non-slip or as close to that as possible) and warm. I am so happy with these boots that I’ve told my sister, my adult daughters who live in snow/ice/cold country, my neighbors… 
Honestly, I don’t know why every shoe store in the town closest to where I live (Steamboat Springs) doesn’t carry them! Those unlucky tourists who buy the “nice looking” winter boots with slick bottoms. When I saw a worthy review from Alaska, I felt certain I’d hit the jackpot. And I have with these boots! They do run large but I stuck with my usual size because I have wide feet (bunions) and also wanted to be able to wear thick, wool socks if I chose to. Glad I did.
review.name: Best Slip-On Low Boot in NW COLORADO!

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof. Leaking at heel seam. Now out of stock, couldn’t replace if wanted.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment:
Hello,
We are sorry to hear that your boots are leaking! It sounds like you may have received a defective pair.  Please reach out to our support team so we can get this resolved and make sure you are 100% satisfied with your purchase. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody:
Warm and dry! What more could a girl ask for? 
I love these so much I bought 2 pair.
review.name: Great for on snow all day

review.reviewBody: Good quality on the product. They wear very well and I would buy them again.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody:
I bought these back in October and they have been the best winter boots I have ever bought. It's vital to have a good pair of winter boots up here in Alaska. I had bought a pair of northface boots that were made to handle deep snow and ice. They were completely outshined by these xtratuffs. 
They kept my feet warm and dry even when the snow came up to my calves. I haven't slipped once this year on the ice, the tread does wear down a bit but they still held up real well. 
10/10 recommend these xtratuffs
review.name: Love these boots

review.reviewBody: I've been buying Xtratuf's for years but always wished I had a winter version to easily slip on. Then I saw these this year and jumped at buying them! They are so great, literally the same as their regular boots, just fleece-lined (and with more traction), so they're perfect for taking my dog on walks, running errands, etc. Highly recommend!
review.name: These boots are the best!

review.reviewBody: These boots are awesome!! I live where it snows a lot and is cold, so the tread and insulation on these boots was a huge selling point. I've worn these shoveling and at many ski races this winter, and they keep my feet dry, warm after hours of standing in the snow and the tread is truly anti-slip!  They're so versatile, I can take a long walk in them, they're great commuting to the ski hill and slip on and off so easy! My only qualm with these boots is they run very big, I wear a 6.5-7 depending on the shoe, but the 7 felt like an 8.5. Once I exchanged for a 6 I was very happy! I can still wear 2 pairs of thick socks comfortably if needed.
review.name: Essential winter boot!!

review.reviewBody: Love that I can easily slip these on and that they are comfortable for long walks even in icy conditions.
review.name: Easy & comfy

review.reviewBody: These might be my fav pair of Xtratuf boots! I wear them while operating our food truck in Alaska and during our recent cold snap, these boots did great at -30 with keeping my feet warm and comfortable with standing on the truck floor. I noticed while outside on the ice and snow that the bottoms don't freeze up and turn hard making it hard to keep traction. The fleece lining is just enough to provide extra warmth and comfort in the cold. These boots are amazing, would love another pair!
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: Easy to slip on and off, nice and warm, good traction
review.name: Perfect winter tuffs

name: ADB Ice Rubber Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought these boots for a 12 day trip to Romania where I did lots of walking and hiking (including up lots of hills, on lots of cobblestone, and up lots of rocky forest uphill and downhill trails). I did not have any time to break them in prior to my trip, but they were extremely comfortable nonetheless, and I am super prone to blisters. No blisters and these took me everywhere the whole trip! I hope they will last me a long time, and they seem like they were totally worth the price! I typically wear a size 9 in most shoes, ended up ordering these in an 8.5, 9, and 9.5, and ended up keeping the 9.5, so I don't recommend sizing down, I went up .5 size and they were perfect with hiking socks.
review.name: Loving these boots so far!

hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Drafter 10L Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have only used it on 2 bike rides so far, but with warmer weather in summer will definitely be using it much more to pack water. 
I switched from a camelback, so it took me a minute to figure out how to adjust shoulder straps so that the water bag actually rides on the lumbar. 
I was skeptical at first, but once properly adjusted it is very comfortable. 
I’ve ridden down one steep black diamond trail with the pack and it was not a hindrance in any way. Forgot I was wearing it. How it should be. 
My only criticism is the lack of zip-able larger cargo compartment for packing rain gear and other things that might fly out of the open pocket thing. The smaller compartments are great for phone , keys, food etc.
review.name: DaKine hydration pack

review.reviewBody:
The pack would receive five stars had it not been for the comically small waist strap that almost every other reviewer has already commented on. I cinched it down and forgot about it, as it doesn't hinder performance.  

Another suggestion is to include helpful images or instructions for looping and adjusting the tubes, straps, and clasps.  - Seriously, some of us noobs have to be saved by other riders we meet on the trails who are kind enough to show us helpful hints and hacks. I checked YT and didn't find any. 

Overall, the pack performs well, and having an almost full day's worth of liquid on hand is a real game changer. I routinely ride 60-80 miles on rural gravel trails. Not worrying about refueling opens up new trails during the warmer summer months. You can fill the bladder with a little over three 28-ounce Gatorade bottles worth of fluid., or for me, more than the four of the water bottles I had been using. 

The airflow and webbing design work. Feeling the breeze channeled over my back has greatly improved my comfort. Having a place to stash the helmet has been more useful than I initially thought it would be. The same goes for the top zippered compartment. 

The pack does an excellent job of distributing the weight. Feel free to load up the pack cause you won't feel it on your back!
review.name: Perfect for Warmer Weather

name: Drafter 10L Hydration Backpack

review.reviewBody: Boa works great by being very convenient, shoe is super comfortable, but the sole is super soft. I run one up alloy pedals and I punctured the sole after 2 rides. Would not buy again.
review.name: Not sure I would purchase again

review.reviewBody:
I have found other flat shoes on the market to either be over-built or basically be a pair of vans. I have used two different Five-Ten models and I’ve been on the Ride Concept Hellion Elites for the last year. They are all great shoes but for how I ride (aggressive trail riding or all-day out riding), but because they are all really overbuilt my foot and toes can go numb and I have trouble feeling my feet inside of the tough/stiff shoe. 

These fit really good and are a perfect blend of comfort and mtb-specific performance. I can feel my feet, feel my pedals, feel what my bike is doing and nothing goes numb. They are just a really soft and comfy shoe once they’re broken in a bit. 

As for grip, the sole itself feels tacky. I would say the soles don’t grip quite as good as the others I’ve had, but because the shoe itself is built a little lighter and I can feel my feet more, I end up having more grip and am able to control my foot on the pedal more. 

For me the biggest thing I wanted was the Boa system. Love them or hate them, they are so convenient and it is really nice to cinch and loosen mid-ride.
review.name: Great Flat Pedal Shoe.

review.reviewBody:
I loved the look (yes, with bright orange dial :-) ) feel and comfort, but I feel that only one BOA dial, maybe too high on the shoe, makes it a bit tough to properly tighten it around the foot, if you compare the "hugging" that you can achieve in road cycling shoes.
I could escape with a size 10 with thicker socks, but a bit of too much toe length (and I have a wide foot), so seeking a 43.5 or US 9.5
review.name: Runs a bit large

review.reviewBody: I have the 'X-Alp Launch Mid' and they are great shoes. If pedal grip is not your #1 concern these are five-star shoes. But there is a noticeable downgrade in grip compared to my normal go-to shoe, five ten freeride pro.
review.name: Just missing the grip

review.reviewBody: Coming off 5/10 Freerider which is a pretty soft shoe.  This is a much much stiffer sole but the rubber feels similarly tacky.  However because of the lack of flex I don't think pedal pins dig as deep into the sole.  Also due to the stiff sole I get less feed back on pedal position but no sore arches on long descents. I think the pin-lock pattern does work well in trapping pins.  Overall the shoe is quite sleek/compact but has good padding with stiff fabrics in key areas.  The tongue is nice and wide (not gusseted) and has good cushion but is thin so you can overtighten the boa system and get tingly toes.  I had to go up a 1/2 size to the correct fit compared to my 5/10s (likely due to 5/10s being oversized). And probably the most important thing to know is that the red colored shoes come with a BRIGHT orange dial not the black one pictured.  I was looking to get away from the foot pillow/skate shoe asthetic with laces that couldn't get snagged and pulled open and after 2 rides I'm very pleased with how these are working.  In my ideal world the sole would be 15% less stiff and the tongue would be attached to the sides of shoe but that might just be my preferences.
review.name: Stiff BOA Flat (and dial is orange)
comment: You can get a black boa directly from the Boa company....if the orange one bothers you.
Are the insoles removable / replaceable?

name: X-Alp Launch Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As an avid snowboarder, I've tried my fair share of gear, but The North Face Women's Snowboarding Clothing truly stands out. From the moment I hit the slopes, I could feel the difference in quality and performance. The materials are top-notch, providing exceptional warmth and protection against the elements without sacrificing mobility. Plus, the stylish design ensures I look good while shredding. Five stars without hesitation!
review.name: Title: Exceptional Performance and Style on the Slopes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are perfect. I skied for three full days in Park City, Utah and they were so comfy and I love the gray color!

review.reviewBody: Good awesome boots she loves them work great great price
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Our daughter asked for a new pair. She's worn the heck out of her first pair. We didn't think we'd get these until after Christmas and they arrived early, before Christmas! Thank you so much, xtratuf! These are so, so cute, she hasn't taken them off since she opened them. The toe box is a little wider than her first pair, which she likes. Super sporty and functional!!
review.name: Daughter's Gift

review.reviewBody: The Ankle Deck Sport Boot is the only Xtratuf boot I have purchased. I have since purchased this line in four different colors. They are so comfortable and I work up to ten hours per shift in a warehouse, where I am on concrete floors on my feet. My feet do not bother me in these boots at all, they are very comfortable and I absolutely love them!
review.name: Best Boots Ever

review.reviewBody: I’ve had my boots for about a year and a half. They are very comfortable and stylish, however, the soles are completely ripping away from the boot. I only wear them fishing so it’s not everyday wear and tear. I’m quite disappointed as I really do like the boot! My husband even tried to glue them back together! Only worked for a day or 2. Hopefully I can find a boot that holds up a bit better.
review.name: Very Disappointed!
comment:
Hello Cindy,
We are sorry to hear your boots are not holding up as we would expect them to.  Please reach out so we can assist you further: xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is one of the best synthetic puff jackets on the market.  Have 2 I just wish it had the Brest Pocket Zipper like the Nano Puff and Retro… love those pockets for carrying my cell phone and other stuff that needs to be accessed quickly!!
review.name: Patagonia Insulated Puff Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket and surprisingly warm. I pretty much wear this jacket every day. I have long arms and was very pleased that the arm length of the jacket!
review.name: New Favorite Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's got the right specs, the best materials, is well-made, and very expensive of course ... and looks straight out of the 70's.  It's so retro my wife laughed because she thought I bought it used on E-Bay.  (I'm normally a Md but bought Sm because I wanted maximum warmth/weight).
review.name: Classic Patagucci

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have the same jacket from 2020 and things are definitely different here. The jacket has become considerably thinner, and strangely smaller. I am 5 11 and 182 lb, and L seems tight. An awkward seam runs on the upper back, making it incredibly uncomfortable. It was perfect before, why change? I noticed the pattern with Patagonia, and their new things are not as good as before. Sad.
review.name: Different From Old Models

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It looks good. It's warm. What I don't like is the insulation fibers come out where the treads are. I sent the first one back thinking it was a flute. The one they exchanged it with is doing the same after I wore it a couple times
review.name: Would not recommend

review.itemreviewed: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Warm, light, and breathable.  What else could you ask for?

Arm holes are a little tight for broad shoulders, needed to size up.
review.name: Best of all worlds

name: Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's
Micro Puff Hooded Insulated Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've only worn these once so far. They kept my feet dry and relatively warm. I tend to run cold and wish the rubber sole would keep more of the cold out, but that's life in wet PNW. These are definitely easier to walk in than other big Sorel winter boots.
review.name: Great boots.

review.reviewBody: These are really nice boots. They would be great boots if shoe sizing was standard. These boots are way too small.
review.name: Too Small
comment: Hello Laurie M., thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our WINTER CARNIVAL™ Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody:
I dont know why these would get a 1 star review because they are absolutely the warmest, most comfortable, waterproof boots I've ever had. Makes me even feel positive that winter is coming 😁
PS don't know why Size is a required field here if size isn't an issue?
review.name: Excellent

hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Back Home Screenhouse online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I enjoyed my gazebo this Summer.  When we started to dismantle for winter when a section of the canopy split.  It appears to be dry rotted.  I live in WV so it would not be like the heat of Florida. I am very disappointed that I’ve had the gazebo for 6 months and this happened. I am further disappointed to read in comments that the canopy can not be purchased separately.  However I read in warranty information that canopies have a 1 year warranty.  Am I eligible?  This was the perfect product for me.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: This was fairly easy to setup and worked well to provide shelter but after 2 months in one location wi the out much rain it developed holes where the top rested on the pieces of the frame that form peaks between each post.
review.name: Decent protection, design flaw punctured roof
comment:
Hi! Thank you for posting your review. We are sorry to hear that our product didn't meet your expectations.
We use all the feedback we receive to continually improve on everything we do. If you require our assistance, please contact us via our official website and we will be happy to assist further.
Thank you!
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: After the first setup, it is very easy to put up and take down. It was a nice addition to our camping trip. I do wish it were more compact when packed up. It barely fit in our truck due to the length.
review.name: As expected

review.reviewBody: Nice quality tent for 1-4 people to enjoy. Great value.
review.name: Another quality Coleman product

review.reviewBody: The roof material is brittle and leaks ar common at the metal joints. The textile quality does not match the robust metal skeleton. I need a new roof after just two summers ☀️.
review.name: Roof textile of low quality
comment:
Hi,
We understand your disappointment for this product. We apologize for any inconvenience that this may have caused you. We would like to learn more about your experience, please contact us at 1-800-835-3278. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time. You can also fill out our contact form: https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or place a formal claim here: https://www.coleman.com/warranty-information.html
Stay safe!
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Bought this for camping to fit a picnic table in. It works great if the weather is nice. It rained and it was dripping through the ceiling all over the picnic table.
review.name: Ceiling not waterproof
comment:
Hello. Thank you for sharing your experience with our Back Home™ 10.5 x 9 Screen Canopy Tent. We're delighted to hear it worked well for your camping trip under fair weather conditions. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused by the dripping during rainy weather. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we're committed to improving our products. Please reach out to us directly via our Coleman "Contact Us" https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us so we can assist you further and ensure your satisfaction with our product. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9am -5pm Eastern Time.

Thank you!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Text was good but a heavy rain brake the poles in 3 places
review.name: Bought on sale

review.reviewBody: Tents good but collapsed during a rain storm broke poles
review.name: Bought on sale

review.reviewBody: I am still in need of purchasing a cover only.   All my communications with you have been to the effect of a cover only
review.name: Having to repeat  my request is concerning
comment:
Hello Jacobs, we appreciate you leaving the review. We're committed to making sure to turn your experience around to a rather delightful one. If you require our assistance, please contact us using our Contact Us form on the following website: https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us-formor through LiveChat so we can help you further. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9 am – 8 pm Eastern Time. Thank you! 
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Bought 2 hats same style  this Ivory was far different in fabric texture, stiff where other softer,  more flexible . I like both hats overall but wish Ivory was softer so would travel better.
review.name: Hat fabrics can differ

review.reviewBody: Very happy with this purchase.  Very cute, high quality hat. I am glad I stumbled across this site. Just ordered two more hats :)
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like this hat but I returned it. I wanted something a little more light weight for the summer. I had bought this hat hoping that it would be an everyday, warm/hot weather hat. It's well made and really nice looking, but the extra fabric on the inside of the crown made it feel a bit warm and heavy on my head. I would have possibly kept it for fall weather.
review.name: Didn't work out for me but nice hat

review.reviewBody: The color and fit are great.  Good quality. I was a bit skeptical, but honestly I really love this hat!
review.name: Terrific sun hat - love the color!

review.reviewBody: Women's hats are always tight on me, but I love cute hats. I've resigned myself to men's functional hats in the summer, and I just skip them when I want to look cute. But no more! The large fits me perfectly! And this hat is beautifully made. I'm so happy I could cry...all over a hat lol.
review.name: I can't believe it actually fits!

review.reviewBody: My son got a job making snow making at a well known ski resort.  He needed a warm mobile boot so I purchased this boot for him.  The boot does the job keeping him warm at a job that requires him to climb up steep slopes carry and wield tools, pipe and fittings in some cold difficult conditions.
review.name: Does the Job

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair Toundra boots, recently. I'm a 10 normally, so I ordered a 10.5. I tried them on late in the day, to allow my feet the swell as normal. They boots felt like a size 9.5  in my normal footwear. So, I've had to purchase a 11 & 11.5 to finally find a pair that fits. Just frustrating that they came up so small relative to the guide sizing. Looking forward to getting out in what look on first appearance, a very good boot.
review.name: Excellent boot, sizing issues.
comment:
Hi Carlos! 
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We 
will be sure to pass on your feedback to the relevant department. 
We are sorry for any inconvenience caused.

review.reviewBody:
Started out as a strong contender for my all time favourite boot. After the first 150kms of hiking they started to deteriorate. I’ve now put close to 350kms on them and unfortunately their next journey is the trash.
- outsoles started ripping +\- 150km 
- inside liner above heel separated after a 10k hike
- waterproofing good for the first 200km 

Overall a good boot for casual wear but if you hike or plan on putting some distance on em don’t waste your money.
review.name: Excellent for the first 150kms
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: These boots are very warm and comfortable, perfect for extremely cold conditions. The grip is excellent, providing stability on icy and snowy surfaces.
review.name: Great warm boots

review.reviewBody: I bought my boots a year ago and  they are very durable and comfortable. The boots definitely keep my feet warm.
review.name: Very comfortable boot and warm

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of these about 13 years ago and still wear them, but they started to leak a couple of years ago when I cut them and the insulation was getting pretty packed down.  I just bought a new pair and they are as I remembered, warm and comfortable.  I just wish they came in WIDE, because I have to order 1 1/2 sizes too big so they are wide enough for my feet.
review.name: The best boots!

review.reviewBody: As soon as I put these on they just felt right, my ankles feel ver secure and safe from sprains and living in the Scottish highlands they are perfect, it was recently -5°C and even walking through several inches of snow my feet were never cold and even better I never slipped once!
review.name: Instant comfort

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a trip to Tromoso Norway. Very warm. They look a little like Herman Munster’s boots but they are really warm. My car landed up in a ditch on the way back from senja bc of the snow. The  ditch was full of slushy icy water. Boots held up great as the water was as full foot depth.
review.name: Very nice boots

review.reviewBody: These are lightweight with a large toe box and have kept my feet super warm.  However cracks developed across the toe box that eventually opened up completely.  On both toes.  Snow and water can get in.  The toebox needs re-engineering.
review.name: Super warm and comfortable but not durable
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: The upper shoe has vulnerable spots on top, where the toe crease is, it breaks apart over time and with regular use/wear. Its unfortunate as this is a really nice shoe but costly for only a years worth of wear??
review.name: Product has Vulnerabilities
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: This is a great sleeping bag coupler and makes camping with a double bag much easier. Relatively light and simple we use it for most trips. On the really light trips we do use two old dynema climbing slings to hold the mats together as their lighter - but for 99% of couples camping this has been great. Highly recommended.
review.name: Couple time

review.reviewBody: It's awesome that this sheet is lightweight and couples two sleeping pads together. It also works as a sheet for the Exped Ultra 3R Duo. The material feels a little slippery/sticky/sweaty on skin and is not that pleasant to sleep on, especially without clothing. I would love to see a coupler sheet made out of a soft lightweight material more similar to the Sea-to-Summit thermolite liners.
review.name: Great idea; poor material

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the grey Latitude hat in March 2019. It has traveled in my suitcase to multiple places over the years, and washing machine cycles, and it still has its shape. Since I started having children in 2019 it gets worn when I am outside no matter what. Most sun hats I have purchased fade from the constant sun exposure, but not the grey one. The brim has lost a lot of its firmness over the years, but it still retains its shape and does not sag or has gotten wrinkly.
Recently I purchased the BlueStone color of this hat and it’s beautiful. My grey one is my main garden hat now the blue one has replaced my daily use.
review.name: Latitude hat lasts through everyday wear & travel

review.reviewBody:
I bought a latitude hat for the LA summer because my bucket hat wasn't giving me enough coverage. I love the Latitude hat.  The width of the brim is great.  No sun hits my face or neck even in midday when the sun is strongest.  The cord allows me to easily dangle the hat around my neck when I enter a shady street.  And the hat is very breathable when on.  I couldn't be happier with it.

I bought a L and XL to compare sizes and definitely needed an XL (my head is on the bigger end).
review.name: Fantastic summer hat

review.reviewBody: have worn your hats only, for 21 years.  They are simply the best i have found, Thanks for making an excellent  product !
review.name: the best for 21 years !

review.reviewBody: Great hat for sun protection. I use it for running in the hot summer sun in the Central Valley of CA. The brim stays sufficiently rigid even when sweat-soaked. My sense is it runs a little big for Sunday Afternoon hats. I have trouble cinching it tight enough to not rest on the top of my ears which is sort of a bummer, but manageable.
review.name: Great hat for sun protection.

review.reviewBody: I purchased size L and it is excellent for a large head. Can be adjusted or secured for wind with either a drawstring or chinstrap. The amount of shade provided by the brim is EXCELLENT. It’s so lightweight that I forget I have it on. It also folds and can travel in a backpack!! I’ve owned many hats that claimed to be foldable, this is the first one that really is: truly keeps its shape. It’s a great hat
review.name: One of the best sun hats I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: Excellent hat.  Finally found a hat that fits my head.  Very good quality
review.name: Excellent hat

review.reviewBody: Wonderful hat for my husband who has a larger head. It is the perfect fit. Breathable, even in 110° weather.
review.name: Great breathable sun hat

review.reviewBody: This hat does a great job at keeping the sun off. And it is comfortable to wear. The extra long brim in the back does hit my day pack, but I can live with that to obtain the great sun protection.
review.name: Great hat for sun protection

review.reviewBody: This is the best sun hat I e ever owned. I love the coverage, materials, and foldable design. I would recommend it without hesitation.
review.name: My favorite hat

review.reviewBody: I love the very wide brim of this hat, and that it can fold flat for packing.  It is a beautiful and flattering color.  It was only available in Large, and the diameter can be adjusted.  However the crown of this hat is too high.  Regardless of how I adjust the diameter, it rides down onto my ears and it's kind of annoying.  I am going to try tacking it up a little.  Will see how that goes!
review.name: A very wide brimmed hat

name: Latitude Hat
Latitude Hat

review.reviewBody: Pretty durable, all around cooler - great for weekend camping or beers at the game. Insulation keeps things cool for a decent period of time, and the spigot to drain ice melt is a great feature. The handles make the cooler easy to carry and the width of the cooler is perfect for carrying comfortably.
review.name: Great value versatile cooler

review.reviewBody: Love our coleman cooler !we take it every where not just for camping. Vacation for snacks and cookouts. Has really became a necessity during Power outages.  Very durable, holds a lot, stays cold for hours is easy to clean, and just a really handy item to have around .
review.name: Excellent cooler

review.reviewBody: The ice doesn’t stay long and the lid doesn’t shut all the way
review.name: The lid doesn’t shut all the way
comment:
Hello. Thank you for your feedback. We’re sorry to hear that you’re having issues with the ice retention and lid closure on your Classic Series 120-Quart Hard Cooler. The cooler is designed to keep ice for extended periods, but performance can vary depending on factors such as the environment and how the cooler is used. As for the lid not shutting completely, it might be worth checking if any debris is obstructing the seal or if there’s a misalignment. If the issues persist, please reach out via our Coleman "Contact Us" https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us for further assistance.

Thank you, 
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: The biggest and sturdiest cooler I’ve ever owned. Perfect for camping or a long tournament. Has wheels so it’s easily mobile and carries A LOT of ice and/or drinks and food. Very easy handle that can be moved up or down and cup holders so you can use it as a table too!
review.name: Huge and very sturdy + versatile

review.reviewBody:
We camp all summer and into the fall. Our cooler is always a part of trips. Great size, easy to clean and keeps everything cold!!
Wouldn’t go camping without it!’
review.name: Durable and a must have for any outing!!

review.reviewBody: Very sturdy cooler. Insulated so well nothing will thaw. Can also be used as a seat for kids. After enjoying all the food you filled it with, pack it with ice to transport your fish.
review.name: Sturdy Cooler

review.reviewBody: Perfect cooler for summer! We use this at all of our get together and we still have ice in it days later. Easy to move and clean. Love the longevity of this brand!
review.name: Perfect summer buy!

review.reviewBody: Very spacious cooler. This one holds everything you need for your event.
review.name: The big one

review.reviewBody:
The Coleman 316 Series Insulated Portable Cooler is perfect for any outdoor adventure or gathering. With its heavy-duty 6-inch wheels and tow & swing-up handles, it is designed for easy transport, making it great for camping, picnics, tailgating, and any other outdoor activity. This fully insulated cooler has a lid and body designed to keep the ice for up to 5 days in temperatures as high as 90°F, making it an ideal choice for longer trips or events.

The have-a-seat lid is a unique feature of this cooler, as it can support up to 250 lbs., allowing you to use it as an extra seat in a pinch. The molded cup holders with drain built into the lid make it easy to keep your drinks from spilling, and they can even fit up to a 30-oz. tumbler.

The cooler's interior is spacious, with the ability to hold up to 160 cans to bring all your favorite drinks and snacks. The stain-resistant liner makes it easy to clean up after use, and the leakproof channel drain plug ensures no unwanted spills.

The recessed lip on the lid makes it easy to access the cooler's contents without any hassle, and the channel drain plug allows for easy draining of excess water. The overall design of the cooler is sleek and stylish, and the blue and white color scheme adds a touch of fun to any outdoor event.
review.name: D durable, reliable, and functional cooler perfect for any outdoor adventure or gathering

review.reviewBody: got it to go camping. cant use it at all for that bc its wayyyy too big for the bear boxes. not their fault thats on me. the things big enough to put a body in
review.name: way too big
comment:
Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience with our Coleman 316 Series120-Quart Hard Cooler. I'm sorry to hear that the products did not fulfill your expectations due to the cooler's size not being appropriate for your needs.This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

name: Classic Series 120qt Hard Cooler

review.reviewBody: I've since moved away from wiregate draws, but these worked well, are fairly light and workable in that category.
review.name: Good wiregate quickdraws

review.reviewBody:
I have purchased 2 packs and I'm very happy with the product. 

They're the envy of chunky-draw-owners and they've held up as well as those beefier draws
review.name: Super light and durable

review.reviewBody: I love these draws. Great sized carabiner and dog bone. Light and confident when clipping bolts and rope. I may swap the bolt side for a solid gate, but I’m in no hurry and love the easy operation and weight.
review.name: Great draws

review.reviewBody:
They are super light, feel great and look great. Unfortunately, first day out using them I got stuck on the same move a fell on the same bolt about 8 times. I was disappointed to see how much the bolt had chipped away at the carabiner after falling and hanging on it only a handful of times. 

Otherwise they're great if you're not expecting to fall.
review.name: Light but not the most durable

review.reviewBody: Crazy how they are so light. I'm almost afraid they'll blow away if I don't keep them on me!
review.name: So light!

review.reviewBody: Been outside a couple of times with this set and can say I am thoroughly impressed. Super easy and smooth to clip into the bolts on the route with good tension to feel safe and sturdy. I bought 2 sets which is more than enough for me and a few friends to climb different routes at the same time. Have had about 10 days out on the crag with these and have seen minor abrasions on the bolt side but no issues with the integrity of the quickdraws. So far pretty impressed have used them for lead climbing and for setting anchors for top rope and haven't found a problem with them yet!
review.name: Nice Quickdraw!

review.reviewBody:
I love how light this QuickDraws are. 
I've been using them every weekend for the past 2-3 months and they still look good and safe. 
The gates are very easy to open when clipping, and the size of the carabiners is perfect for holding them and clipping comfortably. 
I would definitely buy more of these in the future, maybe even the 17cm ones.
review.name: Super light and smooth gates for clipping

review.reviewBody: They work.  Feel great in hand and are easy to clip when up on the wall.

These were purchased because they are so lightweight. Still a solid and rated 21kn. Only complaint is that the bolt side of the dogbone could be ever so slightly tighter to keep the carabiner from flipping around so frequently.
review.name: Lightweight and mostly great quickdraws

review.reviewBody: As expected, these are super light but compromise with smaller carabiners thus smaller gates. Doesn't really bother me and that was the expectation with the purchase. They're also a bit floppy.

name: Sender Wire Quickdraw - 6-Pack

review.reviewBody: I have this bag on each bike I own. It snuggly holds two road tubes (up to 32mm), tire lever, multi-tool, and a CO2 cartridge. To get everything to fit, it's easier to pack the bag off the saddle and put the tubes in first. I like that the leather patch prevents the seat post from getting scratched.  I also like how neatly it sits up under the saddle and away from my legs. I have found the bag to be durable, but I am not hard on things. I saw a couple of reviews mentioned the strap slips off. I am not sure how this is possible. I guess my tip to prevent this is to slide the long strap through the loop on the bottom, before passing the the strap through the metal loop.
review.name: Great bag for two tubes and more

review.reviewBody: Roomy so it sits on my hips and I like it that way. Got lots of compliments!

review.reviewBody:

Great purchase!
