description: Buy the MSR Advance Pro 2 Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Advance Pro 2 Tent: 2-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Advance Pro 2 Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just used on a stormy winter climbing trip.
Held up well in high winds.
But I really wish the door hinged from the top or the side.
Getting in and out during a storm guarantees your getting snow in your tent.
Change the way the door hinges and this would be a near perfect mountaineering tent.
review.name: Good Bivy tent - with one change it could great

review.reviewBody: I'm looking to buy this tent. It look awesome. But the fact there is no optional vestibule make me hesitate between this one and other brands single wall tent.
review.name: Hesitate

review.reviewBody:
HI,
I am very disappointed by the lack of seriousness in the manufacturing of the poles of this tent: none of the aluminum sleeves were correctly glued into the carbon poles. I was lucky to be able to repair it, otherwise it would have cost me the summit.
review.name: Poor manufacturing quality

review.reviewBody: I have not used the tent for it’s true purpose of mountaineering, but it has served as a great all around tent. I’m 6’2” and it’s not very roomy but I make it work with my pack and my boots. I think MSR nailed it with the design and the simplicity of the pitch. My only complaint is that they don’t have any vestibule add ons like the black diamond single wall tents have, otherwise this tent is a great bare minimum all around shelter that’ll keep you safe in any conditions.
review.name: Great little bivvy tent

review.reviewBody:
Easy and quick to set up. It's packs tight and doesn't add much weight to your pack. Ideal tent for backcountry expeditions in any season. It breaths well in dry/cold conditions. I did end up with condensation and water collecting in the corners during a couple of humid days at altitude in the snow. Bring a sponge for those days. 
The light self-supporting frame makes it easy to shake out dirt.
review.name: Great Background Tent

review.reviewBody: My daughter and I were thrilled to purchase two of the Advance Pro tents. We are small women and not overly muscular and we were very careful setting them up. However, both of us had splitting of the carbon poles the first time we used our tents. We were very, very disappointed! The poles should be strong enough for normal use!
review.name: Carbon poles failed

review.reviewBody: Waterproof, windproof, snow-proof, fits anywhere, good ventilation, lightweight, quick setup & breakdown, freestanding, size allows it to retain heat in winter, perfect for one person + gear, size and shape allow for easy pitch while others struggle to find a suitable spot for their tents, nice aesthetic
review.name: Best Tent I've Ever Owned

review.reviewBody: The Advance Pro is my 2nd MSR. I loved it until I encountered rain last weekend. For the price and the quality; I was not worried till I started getting drips over my head and little puddles on each corners. Disappointed
review.name: Bad in rain

review.reviewBody: It's a great 4 season tent for short people. I'm 6'2"" so I have a 6'6"" inside length winter sleeping bag. Consider 8 inches of down insulation for a winter sleeping bag. 78 inches for the inside of the bag plus 16 inches (2 x 8 inches) for insulation is 94 inches. 94 inches or the sleeping bag is squished against the tent wall and it's cold. This tent is 82 inches long. Not even close. Does anyone make a light long 4 season tent like this for taller people? C'mon MSR help us out!
review.name: MSR Advance Pro 2

review.reviewBody: I've camped on dirt, gravel, and snow with this tent--each time it proves to be exceptional in keeping out water, wind, and the cold. It's light and packs well and provides good ventilation to cook in during rainy days (I'd keep the door 3/4 open if I'm cooking multiple meals to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning). There are some small things I did not like, for example, I'm not a fan of how the door opens. The top-down opening causes a lot of snow and water to drip into the tent. It is small for a 2-man, but perfect for an alpine 1-man. I'm also wondering whether its possible to buy an add-on vestibule. Overall an exceptional tent. I'd recommend it.
review.name: Good for moderate to light-extreme mountaineering!

name: Advance Pro 2 Tent: 2-Person 4-Season

hasVariant.name: Shield 22L Pannier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Shield 22L Pannier online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought it to replace my 8 years old pannier which I use 5 days a week to and from work. My lunch is store in several glass jars so it is quite heavy. This pannier is strong and sturdy to handle the load and the hooks are easy to attach and detach from my rack. This winter in Vancouver rains a lot and this bag is perfect for my need. I will buy it again if I need an extra pannier.
review.name: My perfect pannier

review.reviewBody:
Love this bag and the size, quality of the bag itself and the design for a computer and all my things. 

Don’t love the attachment hooks as they back off over the course of my ride where it’s bumpy (trestles, cross walk lines etc). If your ride is smooth it’s excellent. If not… bring bungees 

Quality of the bag is excellent. The hooks are sub par
review.name: Greta bag, not so great attachment hooks

review.reviewBody: Thule bike packs are the best! I like how roomy they are.
review.name: Easy on/off

review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair of these bags over 5 years ago for the wife and they made biking to work a ton easier with no issues with keeping items safe and dry.
Now the kids ride to school and they will get years of quality transport of their gear.

Super happy!!! 😃
review.name: Couple gifts for the kids

review.reviewBody: I use this bag for grocery shopping and my daily work commute (~7 miles each way) attached to my Thule rack on my Santa Cruz MTB, and it looks and works great. After more than 6 months, the bag is working as expected and I highly recommend it. Top quality and design.
review.name: Great Thule bag for my daily commute

review.reviewBody: This bag is nicely designed and has all of the features a commuter could want.  It's unfortunate that this bag is completely let down by the mounting system.  This bag has come off of my Trek Allant 8S twice and gone skidding across the pavement.  I cannot trust this bag at this point and do not recommend it.
review.name: Nicely designed, poor performance
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Shield Pannier bags. I am sorry to hear they did not fit your Trek Allant securely. 
The Thule Shield is designed to fit to most cargo racks measuring 8-16mm without the need for adapters. It sounds like the rack used with your bike was either not within that specifications, or did not provide adequate mounting points to attach the bag securely. 
If you would like troubleshooting assistance on this bag, please contact Thule Customer Support so one of our agents can take a closer look at the system and provide any possible recommendations:
https://help.thule.com/s/contactsupport?language=en_US

name: Shield 22L Pannier

review.reviewBody: Really great!! Particularly like that it filters out most plastic.

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: This is a quality product. I love how I can put tap water in here and it always tastes great! My only complaint is that it's not entirely easy to get the water through the filter. (Although it's a necessary issue), it takes some getting used to. I'd recommend the Go Series to anyone.
review.name: No More Water Bottles

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: The bottle is nice, color is nice. The cleaning will take some getting use to because there are extra parts. It's a little awkward to drink at first and don't fill the bottle up, water will overflow when you close the lid because of the filter.
review.name: Honest Review

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: Just what we were after. We bought the life straw go series for our last big trip away and used it everywhere. It was great knowing you could drink any water. However, we wanted a thinner bottle as the big 1 l doesn’t fit in our backpack side pockets. Also we wanted one that kept water cool too.
review.name: Exactly what we were after

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: Love this bottle! I purchased for a trip to Costa Rica but am using it daily anyway. The feel is comfortable and I’m shocked it fits in my car cup holder. I will be buying a few more for Christmas gifts for family.
review.name: Love this bottle

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: I love the water filter in these bottles. The only issue i have is it doesn't fit in any cup holders.. Aside from that you can't beat the quality..
review.name: Great water bottle

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: Easy to use; keeps its cool; looks great. But not light to carry.
review.name: Great water bottle

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: Very heavy (even just the bottle with the lid/filter removed) compared with my other steel water bottles. Awkward to open bottle and drink through the straw. I absolutely prefer a separate filter and lighter weight bottle.
review.name: Too heavy. Awkward to use

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: The stainless steel 24 oz is great. It keeps my water cold all day ( I add ice ). I would buy it again!!!!!
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Go Series Stainless Steel Filter Bottle - 24oz
review.reviewBody: Knowing my children can be anywhere, fill it up at any tap or water fountain and still getting clean water just makes sense! Thank you, we need kid sized ones :)
review.name: LOVE*With peace of mind!

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I’ve tried ExOfficio’s other styles. I like these because they hug your thighs so there’s not material bunching up when I pull my jeans on. The material is wicking which makes them comfortable to wear and quick to dry after washing. Great for traveling.

review.reviewBody: I found this brand in a random store in 2017 and bought 3 pair. All three of those are still going strong and are like new comfortable to this day. I bought another 3 pair from the website but they are not the same thing apparently. Less than 3 months in of regular use has worn holes in them. Do better exofficio.

I was so excited to try these and waited till a pair went on sale to finally purchase and I am disappointed.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Danner Crag Rat Hiking Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Best boot I've ever had in term of fit and finish. I have yet to give it an endurance rating as I just began to wear them. I bought 8 medium and I normally wear a 7.5. Love this fit.
At first glance it was easy to see the Genius behind the construction of the Tongue. I've read so many complaints about how the tongue was too large and how bad it hurt people's feet. The first observation was that the tongue is an Exterior Tongue. It was made to be placed  under the laces but Not under the holes like your tennis shoe!! This provides superior water shedding and added comfort across the top of your foot. What I don't understand is why soo many folks missed this! 
Carry On and Happy trails!!
review.name: I love this Boot!

review.reviewBody:
I do really like these.  I swear by the Crater Rims, which I think everyone thinks of as the sibling to the Crag Rats.  These feel like more of an every day boot - they're more flexible, they're softer, they seem to breathe a little better (though that may be my imagination).

There are some common complaints out there that show up over and over in reviews.  The tongue is too big, but I feel like that's been done to provide some padding and structure for the front of your boot.  It breaks in fast and stops being a problem.  The lacing system isn't super great, but I wouldn't call it bad.  You end up spending slightly longer to get them laced up, but it's really fine.  I saw that a lot of people said they were too narrow but I don't think so.  They're more snug than other boots, but I don't at all feel like the sizing is off or anything.  Right now, my suspicion is that the snugness is to do with the leather being new.

I do feel like it's odd how these are categorized (on Backcountry, on Danner's site, pretty much everywhere) as backpacking boots.   I feel like backpacking boots, at least the ones I've learned I prefer, are so much more rigid - and stable as a consequence.  If the Crag Rats weren't marketed that way, it would never occur to me that anyone would opt to use them that way.

These are really comfortable and I think they're going to break in really nicely.  They feel tough and like they'll put up with a decent amount of use/abuse/wear/tear.  I'm happy with them, glad I picked them up.
review.name: Not mind-blowing, but very, very good.
comment: Good review. Did you buy your actual size or go up 1/2 or a full size? Thanks.

name: Crag Rat Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Small shoulders. Had to giveaway . I’ve been a medium in Marmot synthetic jackets since their first one and now suddenly the fit changes . I won’t go to a large because it comprises the function of paying so much for a technical jacket when the arms are too long and too baggy in chest and body to be able to accommodate shoulder rotation without pinching by jacket.
review.name: Poor.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jackets fits true to size.  It’s warm and light weight.  I especially like the deal on the back.
review.name: Looks & Fits Nice

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket for me. I replaced a 15 year old Marmot jacket with the Featherless and can’t believe how much lighter it is. I live in the Pacific Northwest so I didn’t want down with all the rain we get. The style is slimming and I like it’s a little longer in the back.
review.name: Light Warm Featherless Jacket.

review.reviewBody: A little bit short in length, but a beautiful blue color, lightweight but very warm, and possible to layer over and under (which I did often while skiing in temps 0-10F). Would recommend to anyone that is maybe shorter than 5’9” (or people with average length torsos..if you are tall or long in the torso, I probably would skip this one).
review.name: Warm, lightweight, beautiful blue..a little short

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a great fit. It’s light and warm and fits perfectly under the Torrey EvoDry jacket. It looks and feels great whether I’m going to dinner or working outside. Highly recommended.
review.name: The Perfect Winter Versatile Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Very warm. Love the color
Sleeves and length a little long on a petite body but otherwise fits well
Not particularly fond of the U shape on the back hem
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: Very packable, extremely comfy. Only complaint is some leakage at arm seams in high wind; otherwise, very warm, attractive, and light!
review.name: Lovely travel jacket

review.reviewBody: Got a chance to wear it for the first time. Love it, just a little less classic than what I’d hoped for. But so light and warm! Can be used for a ton of occasions.
review.name: Glad it snowed yesterday

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket! It's lightweight but super warm. It being some compact/packable also makes it great for traveling. The fit is also nice that's it's a little cut in to provide some shape for woman rather than just being a box cut. Tempted to buy in other colors but they were out of my size.
review.name: Great jacket, warm and travel friendly

review.reviewBody: Love the design of this Marmot jacket. Very flattering for a formfitting hourglass shape yet still offers a good range of movement in the shoulders/sleeves. The jacket keeps me warm to 20 degrees or so, depending on humidity, wind, and level of activity (if I'm in the city and it gets colder, I'd rather wear a longer coat.) Stitching detail and diamond pattern makes the jacket look sleek and great. My only complaint is that a few times the nonfeather filling has poked out. (Don't pull it, they're not feathers and might come out in strings. Pull it back in from the other side.) Washes well in machine gentle and keeps its shape. Still looks great after two years of wear. Order your usual size (when I sized up one I had to return it); if in between sizes, I'd go smaller. The curve of the jacket accommodates short to long waists and the back covers my bottom. The bottom hem has a hidden drawstring, which I never use but some might find it handy. Happily, the sleeves accommodate long arms but are easy to shorten by rolling under. The hem on the sleeves is taped so it's sleeker than gathered elastic. The jacket has an inside pocket parallel to the zipper, handy for a cell or smartphone. The two diagonal outside pockets can hold gloves, wallet, phone, a hat. The line is so great that for casual wear I avoid overstuffing the pockets. If you like to travel light, consider springing for the hooded version of this. This version has a nice high neck to keep out drafts, but if it's cold I add a hat. In some websites the colors have been off (didn't like the lavender, it had too much gray) but I've really liked the jewel tones and would love to see a bright light orange, too. If you're eager for an escape from boxy, this is it. Lots of compliments for this jacket.
review.name: Marmot Featherless - great design, functional

name: Featherless Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've ridden in Louis Garneau bibs in the past and one reason I'm checking these out. The fit (medium) is perfect for my build. The material is thin and breathable and the chamois is pretty nice/good quality. One con (IMO) are the two little 'pockets' on the thighs...I wouldn't trust putting anything valuable in those but they would work for an energy bar/gel, etc....but that's what my short pockets or backpack are for (these are marketed as 'liner bibs'). Overall, a good pair of bibs for the price.
review.name: Great Bibs

name: MTB Inner Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Yogger IV Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the RVCA Yogger IV Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Really like these shorts. They are lightweight and comfortable. The length is just right (for me at least) to not go over my knees while lifting but not so short they feel like I'm showing off my upper UPPER thighs in a not so flattering way.
review.name: Great Workout Shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts have been a great addition! They are an awesome gym/running short and they are by far the comfiest pair of shorts that I own. I use them to workout, lounge around the house, hike, and they are lightweight enough to use as a swim short if needed.  The fit and material are high quality and Lightweight. I highly recommend these. I'll be adding more to the collection soon!
review.name: Does it all!

review.reviewBody: Have turned into my favorite shorts! Super light and comfy
review.name: good stuff

name: Yogger IV Short - Men's

description: Buy the GSI Outdoors Spice Missile online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spice Missile
hasVariant.description: Buy the GSI Outdoors Spice Missile online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought one new at REI and the next day the very top of the grey cap got separated from the rest of the cap! It was as if they were glued together. It had not been dropped or pressure exerted on it. You get what you pay for I guess.
review.name: Cheap and brittle

review.reviewBody: I bought this shaker because I liked the variety it would offer, having 6 compartments. I work as an outdoor guide, so I am backpacking 2 weeks a month and could use more flavor in my meals.  I found the spice rocket to be unnecessarily heavy, and the holes in the cap were so small I had to shake for a minute to get enough spice out. I am still looking for better options but will be returning to using plastic baggies for now.
review.name: Doesn?t shake well

name: Spice Missile
